t: Job 19
Job Trusts in His Redeemer
Then*p Job answered and said:
“How*pn long will you torment my soul, And*ld break me in pieces with words?
These*ld ten times you have reproached me; You*ld are not ashamed that*i you have wronged me.
And*ld if indeed I have erred, My*ld error remains with me.
If*ld indeed you exalt yourselves*i against me, And*ld plead my disgrace against me,
Know*ld then that God has wronged me, And*ld has surrounded me with His net.
“If*ln I cry out concerning wrong, I am not heard. If*ld I cry aloud, there*i is*i no justice.
He*ld has fenced up my way, so that I cannot pass; And*ld He has set darkness in my paths.
He*ld has stripped me of my glory, And*ld taken the crown from*i my head.
He*ld breaks me down on every side, And*ld I am gone; My*ld hope He has uprooted like a tree.
He*ld has also kindled His wrath against me, And*ld He counts me as one*i of*i His enemies.
His*ld troops come together And*ld build up their road against me; They*ld encamp all around my tent.
“He*ln has removed my brothers far from me, And*ld my acquaintances are completely estranged from me.
My*ld relatives have failed, And*ld my close friends have forgotten me.
Those*ld who dwell in my house, and my maidservants, Count*ld me as a stranger; I*ld am an alien in their sight.
I*ld call my servant, but he gives no answer; I*ld beg him with my mouth.
My*ld breath is offensive to my wife, And*ld I am repulsive to the children of my own body.
Even*ld young children despise me; I*ld arise, and they speak against me.
All*ld my close friends abhor me, And*ld those whom I love have turned against me.
My*ld bone clings to my skin and to my flesh, And*ld I have escaped by the skin of my teeth.
“Have*ln pity on me, have pity on me, O you my friends, For*ld the hand of God has struck me!
Why*ld do you persecute me as God does,*i And*ld are not satisfied with my flesh?
“Oh,*ln that my words were written! Oh,*ld that they were inscribed in a book!
That*ld they were engraved on a rock With*ld an iron pen and lead, forever!
For*ld I know that*i my Redeemer lives, And*ld He shall stand at last on the earth;
And*ld after my skin is destroyed, this I*i know,*i That*ld in my flesh I shall see God,
Whom*ld I shall see for myself, And*ld my eyes shall behold, and not another. How*ild my heart yearns within me!
If*ld you should say, ‘How shall we persecute him?’— Since*ld the root of the matter is found in me,
Be*ld afraid of the sword for yourselves; For*ld wrath brings*i the punishment of the sword, That*ld you may know there*i is*i a judgment.”
